answers.answer: Its really common In Australia for women to come off work at 36wks. I planned to work up until 36wks but had complications at 28wks and had baby at 35wks. Some workplaces actually require you to provide a certificate to say you're fit for work if you intend on working passed 36wks here.
With my first 2 I think I stopped working when I was 36/37 weeks. And then I took like 2-3 weeks vacay

I have the same thing...I found out I had gestational diabetes at 30 wks and I work 40 hrs a wk (in retail).  But I was lucky bc my job worked with me and made sure I took my sugar all the time. Luckily, I dont need to do it anymore bc my counts been fine and now imI'm approaching 38 wks.  My last day of work is this tues.

I Don't have much anual leave at work as I had to use most of it up when I was sick as I had used my sick days so I go off work only 12 days before due date. I am struggling with back ache and ligament pains and feeling exausted but I jist have to carry on. :-(

I worked 50+ hrs a week until I was 36 weeks. The only reason I stopped then was BC I was gestational diabetic with gallbladder disease and I was told if I had one more major attack they would do emergency surgery and have to deliver my son in the process. If it wasn't for that I prob would have worked longer. I was a fast food manager on 3rd shift so I couldn't chance it. I didn't know the first attack was gallbladder it felt like labor. With this one I'm working as long as absolutely possible.

question: im 30 weeks still working full time, back and stomach is aching I have gestational diabetes and struggle doing the test on time when at work. want to know what you ladies have done and for advise?
title: when did you ladies stop working full time
